page.title: 11Stonehouse Farm
page.content: Mr McDermid lives on Stonehouse Farm outside Hardgate. He spent the early part of his life in Ayrshire. He is interested in Clydesdale horses, and has five of his own just for showing. A good Clydesdale horse would cost around about 2,000 pounds. Mares are wanted more than stallions. Stallions go at a killing price of around 250 pounds to be eaten by the Belgians. He has 185 acres of land, 45 of which are hay and silage, 85 of which are for barley and 55 for grazing his 130 cattle. There is a new weed that has been troubling Mr McDermid. It is called soft brome grass. It has been here for about 10 years and it comes from New Zealand. It is a problem because it seeds more than a month before anything else, and this makes it too tough for silage.
